SENT.plain: PURPOSE: It is known from autopsy studies that thromboembolic stroke can be caused by red, white and mixed clots

We therefore examined whether the efficacy of thrombolysis with recombinant tissue-type plasminogen activator (rt-PA) depends on the proportions of fibrin and erythrocytes within thromboembolic material
METHODS: In 23 rabbits intraarterial thrombolysis with 3 mg rt-PA/kg body weight was started 30 minutes after middle cerebral artery occlusion with either red or white autologous emboli 20 hours old
Cerebral perfusion was monitored by MRI
RESULTS: rt-PA enhanced lysis of red but not of white emboli and decreased the infarct volume only if vascular occlusion was due to red emboli (p <.01)

Cerebral perfusion improved only in the red treatment group where the normalized first moment (NFM) decreased (p <.05) and the relative regional cerebral blood volume (rrCBV) reached normal values (p <.05)

CONCLUSION: We suggest that in our animal model the efficacy of thrombolysis increases with the proportion of erythrocytes within thromboembolic material and decreases with its content of fibrin. lf these findings would also be applicable to patients, pretherapeutic estimation of the efficacy of thrombolysis might become feasible because the CT values of red and white thrombi differ
